snippet: History shows that public confidence is fickle and little understood, but it can have great influence on the markets and the economy.
abstract: Robert J Shiller Economic View column observes that history shows public confidence is fickle and little understood, but it can have great influence on the markets and the economy; contends that public thinking is inscrutable and economists will be puzzled again the next time markets or the economy make major moves.
lead_paragraph: History shows that public confidence is fickle and little understood, but it can have great influence on the markets and the economy.

headline.print_headline: Yes, We’re Confident, But Who Knows Why
headline.seo: Confidence and Its Effects on the Economy
headline.main: Yes, We’re Confident, but Who Knows Why
